node.name: ELI4
node.node: Being able to trust others and negotiate, cooperate, work as a team, give and take, see other people`s point of view, cope when things don`t go your way, have good self-control, make wise choices and decisions that are good for you and others. able to laugh at themselvesable to laugh at themselvesunable to laugh at themselvesable to laugh at themselves sometimesnullwould say sorry when they had done something wrongwould say sorry when they had done something wrongwould never say sorry if they had done something wrongwould sometimes say sorry they had done something wrong nullcurious about what's on children ‘s mindscurious about what's on children‘s mindsnot interested in what's on children’s mindsoccasionally curious about what's on children's mindsnullunderstands childrenreads children like a bookdoesn't understand children that wellunderstands children to some extentnulltalks to children about their own life talks to children about their own life says little about their own life talks to children sometimes a bit about their life nullquestions rather than criticisesquestions rather than criticisescriticises frequentlyquestions rather than criticises sometimesnull

I want-it-now attitude, I think I can just do what I like, I think I am better than everyone else. makes hurtful and sarcastic commentsis always respectful of childrenmakes hurtful and sarcastic commentssometimes makes hurtful and sarcastic comments nullis selfish and puts themselves firstputs children’s needs firstis selfish and puts themselves firstis sometimes selfishnulldownplays children’s concernspicks up on children’s concernsdownplays children’s concernsto some extent downplays children’s concernsnullis feared by childrenis respected by childrenis feared by childrenis feared by children on occasionsnullgets annoyed easily and takes it out on the childrendoesn’t take out their annoyance on the children gets annoyed easily and takes it out on the childrensometimes takes out their annoyance on the childrennullmakes all the decisionssupports children to make their own mind upmakes all the decisionsmakes most of the decisionsnull

Being kind and friendly and comfortable with others, aware of the impact of your behaviour on others, care for, help and protect others, play safely with others, take a stand against bullying, be willing to depend on others. spends time doing fun things with childrenspends time doing fun things with childrentoo busy to spend time with childrenspends time with them now and againnullchildren enjoy telling things tochildren enjoy telling things tois hard to talk tochildren tell them things sometimesnullrespects children's point of viewrespects children's point of viewdoesn't see things from the children’s point of viewis aware of children’s point of view nullknows what the children like and dislikeknows what the children like and dislikedoesn’t know what the children like and dislikeknows to some extent what the children like and dislikenullshows a lot of interest in children’s livesshows a lot of interest in children’s livesdoesn’t show much interest in children's livesshows some interest in children’s livesnullis patientis patientis impatientis patient sometimesnull

Annoying, alienating and rubbishing your peers, or going it alone, having doubts about others, finding it hard to make relationships. shows favouritismtreats everyone equallyshows favouritismshows favouritism sometimesnullfrequently shows disapprovalis accepting of childrenfrequently shows disapprovalsometimes shows disapprovalnullunreasonably sternenjoys a laugh with childrenunreasonably sternstern at timesnulldoesn’t tune into how children are feelingnotices how children are feelingdoesn’t tune into how children are feelingsometimes fails to tune into how children are feelingnulltalks down to childrentalks children' s languagetalks down to childrentalks down to children sometimesnullshouts a lot at childrenprefers to speak quietly to childrenshouts a lot at childrensometimes shouts at childrennull

Try your best, stretch yourself, be conscientious, enjoy and be open to learning, be inquiring and creative, take criticism well, focus and shift attention and persist on tasks, and learn from mistakes. helps children feel proud of themselveshelps children feel proud of themselvesmake children feel bad about themselveshelps children feel proud sometimesnullhelps children recognise their skills and achievementshelps children recognise their skills and achievementsdoesn’t recognise children’s skills and achievementshelps children recognise some skills and achievementsnullstretches children so they know how well they can dostretches children so they know how well they can dodoesn't stretch childrenstretches children a bitnullgets excited and enthusiastic about things children are doinggets excited and enthusiastic about things children are doinglacks enthusiasm about children’s activitiesgets excited and enthusiastic about some thingsnullencourages an interest in lots of different thingsencourages an interest in lots of different thingsdoesn't support children to develop interestsencourages a few interestsnullencourages children to set goals that are hard but achievableencourages children to set goals that are hard but achievablesets unrealistic or too easy goalssometimes encourages children to set hard goalsnull

Being lazy, do as little work as you can get away with, easily distracted and put off your work, don`t care about your work, feel you are good at nothing. Is impossible to pleaseshows they are pleased with childrenIs impossible to pleaseIs impossible to please in some areasnulltalks about children’s bad points in front of anyonedoesn't criticise children in front of otherstalks about children’s bad points in front of anyonetalks about children’s bad points in front of others sometimesnullgets too upset by children’s failure to be helpfulhelps children deal well with and learn from failuregets too upset by children’s failure to be helpfulgets upset by children’s failure sometimesnulldoes all the talkinggood at getting children to talkdoes all the talkingdoes most of the talkingnulldistracts or interferes with children’s learningsupports children in staying focuseddistracts or interferes with children’s learningdistracts or interferes with children’s learning from time to timenulloften gives praise when children don't really deserve itgives praise only when children deserve itoften gives praise when children don't really deserve itsometimes gives praise when children don't really deserve itnull

Express self and voice opinions, stand up for self, show your talents, resist peer pressure, push self, be competitive, be sure about self and what you want to do, show initiative, be decisive, direct and bold, make things happen, get things done. trusts children with regular responsibilities in the hometrusts children with regular responsibilities in the homedoes not feel able to trust childrengives children some responsibilitiesnullinvolves children routinely in family decisionsinvolves children routinely in family decisionsdoes not involve children in family decisionsinvolves children in occasional family decisionsnullsets clear and reasonable limitssets clear and reasonable limitsdoes not set limitssets limits sometimesnullinvites children to suggest other ways to do thingsinvites children to suggest other ways to do thingsdoesn't allow children to suggest other ways to do thingsinvites children to suggest other ways to do some thingsnullencourages children to ask questions and say what they thinkencourages children to ask questions and say what they thinkdoesn't encourage children to ask questions or say what they thinksometimes encourages children to ask questions or say what they thinknullencourages children to do things independentlyencourages children to do things independentlytries to do too much for childrenencourages children to do some things independentlynull

Being apprehensive, a bit of a pushover, avoiding being picked or taking on responsibilities; would like to get close to others but are apprehensive about being rejected, would like to get involved but worried about getting things wrong tries to please children too muchmakes appropriate demands on childrentries to please children too muchtries to please children too much sometimesnullfrequently ignored by childrenchildren respond to themfrequently ignored by childreneasy to ignore sometimesnullnags and moans at childrengets the message across firmlynags and moans at childrennags and moans at children at timesnullgives too many choicesoffers considered choicesgives too many choicessometimes gives too many choicesnullsomewhat smotheringencourages children to take riskssomewhat smotheringhas a tendency to be over protectivenulltoo soft with childrenstrict enough with childrentoo soft with childrensometimes too soft with childrennull

questions.question: Q1. What makes it worth coming home to?
Q2. What percentage of your ability are you using in your home life? 0 - 100%
Q3. What is putting you off and stopping you using ALL your ability?
Q4. What is your reputation at home?
Q5. At home, how much of the time can you be your real self - 0 to 100%
Q6. What is stopping you being your real self all the time?
Q7. Would you like to improve anything about your attitude to your children, if so, what?
Q8. Doing this questionnaire, is there anything you have learned about yourself? If so what?
